a French dessert (= sweet food)made from eggs, sugar, and sweet wine mixed together over heat and served warm or cold: I spooned the sabayon over the chopped fruit. For dessert, we had strawberries with a warm sabayon.
More examplesFewer examplesIt takes a good five minutes of whisking to get the sabayon to the right consistency.They do some wonderful desserts here, such as their lemon sabayon.The lime sabayon had a delightfully frothy texture.Unfortunately, the sabayon had gone cold by the time it reached the table.
